awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Integral Geometry and Related Topics in Geometric Analysis
awd_abstract_narration: The principal investigator will continue to investigate                    questions of integral geometry and related problems in geometric                analysis.  He will investigate Radon transformations along                      submanifolds of symmetric spaces, finite analogues of Radon                     transformations, and further geometric inequalities for convex                  bodies and the Busemann-Petty problem.  In a separate vein, he                  will investigate group-invariant function theory on Hermitian                   symmetric domains.  A microcomputer will be used to perform                     experiments in geometric inequalities for finite Radon                          transformations.                                                                     Convex three dimensional polyhedra include the cube,                       pyramid, and other classic solids of Euclidean geometry.  In the                theory of integral geometry, one might compute the probability                  that an arbitrary line in three dimensional space intersects both               the origin and one of these polyhedra.  Using a computer to                     motivate his mode of attack, the principal investigator will                    solve deep generalizations of such problems.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
